full_text:
COURSE NAME: AWS Cloud Practitioner

COURSE OVERVIEW: The course invites participants to learn AWS cloud technologies at Bar-Ilan University's School of High-Tech and Cyber. The course is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of AWS Cloud, its infrastructure, and its services.

COURSE SCHEDULE: The course will start on 29.11.2024. Classes will be held on Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and on Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00. The course consists of 10 sessions, totaling 50 academic hours.

LEARNING FORMAT: The course is hybrid, offering the flexibility to attend classes either on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan or via Zoom.

COURSE TOPICS: The course covers the following topics:
- Define what the AWS Cloud is and the basic global infrastructure.
- Describe basic AWS Cloud architectural principles.
- Describe the AWS Cloud value proposition.
- Describe key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases, such as compute and analytics.
- Describe basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.
- Define the billing, account management, and pricing models.
- Identify sources of documentation or technical assistance.
- Describe basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: For scheduling an admission interview and registration, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or via email at esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.
